title: How to Make Watermelon Stars

steps.headline: Cut several slices of watermelon approximately 2.5cm/1 inch in thickness.
steps.description: You can remove the peel if you want but it doesn't really matter, as you'll only be working with the watermelon flesh.

steps.headline: Insert the star shaped cutter into the flesh to make stars.
steps.description: Make as many as you can.

steps.headline: Use the watermelon stars.
steps.description:
There are lots of possibilities for using the watermelon stars. Here are just a few:
Add to fruit salads. Give to children as an afternoon snack. Use as a decoration on top of a cake, pavlova, cheesecake or other dessert. Fill a bowl for a quick and pretty snack. This can be a great addition to a workplace or office morning/afternoon tea. Dip halfway in melted chocolate. Allow to set on a sheet of parchment or wax paper. Serve the chocolate watermelon star treats on a plate––these would be lovely accompanied by strawberries dipped in the same way. Use as part of a fruit fondue. Add to cocktails or drinks. They can be inserted directly into the drink or they can be placed on the edge of the glass as a garnish. Cut out a half moon shape as well and arrange the watermelon moon and stars on a platter with sweet dips.

steps.headline: Make the watermelon stars as above.
Slide each watermelon star onto a popsicle stick.
Arrange the popsicles onto a wax or parchment lined cookie sheet.
Place in the refrigerator to freeze for an hour (or until firm).
Remove and serve immediately.
steps.description: These are delicious party treats that don't have all the sugar and artificial ingredients of many popsicles.

text:
Steps Cut several slices of watermelon approximately 2.5cm/1 inch in thickness. You can remove the peel if you want but it doesn't really matter, as you'll only be working with the watermelon flesh. Insert the star shaped cutter into the flesh to make stars. Make as many as you can. Use the watermelon stars. There are lots of possibilities for using the watermelon stars. Here are just a few:
Add to fruit salads. Give to children as an afternoon snack. Use as a decoration on top of a cake, pavlova, cheesecake or other dessert. Fill a bowl for a quick and pretty snack. This can be a great addition to a workplace or office morning/afternoon tea. Dip halfway in melted chocolate. Allow to set on a sheet of parchment or wax paper. Serve the chocolate watermelon star treats on a plate––these would be lovely accompanied by strawberries dipped in the same way. Use as part of a fruit fondue. Add to cocktails or drinks. They can be inserted directly into the drink or they can be placed on the edge of the glass as a garnish. Cut out a half moon shape as well and arrange the watermelon moon and stars on a platter with sweet dips. Watermelon star pops Make the watermelon stars as above.  Slide each watermelon star onto a popsicle stick.  Arrange the popsicles onto a wax or parchment lined cookie sheet. Cover with food-grade plastic wrap. Place in the refrigerator to freeze for an hour (or until firm).  Remove and serve immediately. These are delicious party treats that don't have all the sugar and artificial ingredients of many popsicles. Finished.
